contentrichtext.text: {{other uses}} [[File:Draupadi humiliated RRV crop.jpg|thumb|150px|Draupadi humiliated]] '''Virata''' ({{lang-sa|विराट}}), in the [[Hinduism|Hindu]] epic ''[[Mahabharata]]'', was a king in whose court the [[Pandavas]] spent a year in concealment during their exile. Virata was married to [[Sudeshna|Queen Sudeshna]] and was the father of Prince [[Uttara (Mahabharata)|Uttara]] and Princess [[Uttara (Mahabharata)|Uttarā]], who married [[Abhimanyu]] son of [[Arjuna]]. Their son [[Parikshit]] succeeded [[Yudhisthira]] to the throne of [[Hastinapura]], after the war of [[Mahabharata]].<ref>{{cite book|last= Dowson|first= John|title=A Classical Dictionary of Hindu Mythology and Religion, Geography, History, and Literature|url=http://www.archive.org/stream/aclassicaldictio00dowsuoft#page/n45/mode/2up|year=1888|publisher=Trubner & Co., London|page=1}}</ref> He is finally killed by [[Drona]] during the [[Kurukshetra War|Great war of Kurukshetra]] along with his four sons, namely [[Uttara (Mahabharata)|Uttara]], [[Shveta]],Satanika and [[Shankha (Mahabharata)|Shankha]]. ==See also== * [[Virata Kingdom]] ==References== {{Reflist}} *Swami Ramsukhdas: Shrimad Bhagvadgita - Sadhaka-Sanjivani, translated into English by S.C.
